verses.verse: Did I ever say, ‘Bring something to me’? Or, ‘Offer a bribe for me from your wealth’?
Or, ‘Deliver me from the enemy’s hand’? Or, ‘Redeem me from the hand of oppressors’?
“Teach me, and I will hold my tongue; Cause me to understand wherein I have erred.
How forceful are right words! But what does your arguing prove?
Do you intend to rebuke my words, And the speeches of a desperate one, which are as wind?
Yes, you overwhelm the fatherless, And you (Ps. 57:6) undermine your friend.
Now therefore, be pleased to look at me; For I would never lie to your face.
(Job 17:10) Yield now, let there be no injustice! Yes, concede, my (Job 27:5, 6; 34:5) righteousness still stands!
Is there injustice on my tongue? Cannot my taste discern the unsavory?
Job: My Suffering Is Comfortless “Is there not ((Job 14:5, 13, 14); Ps. 39:4) a time of hard service for man on earth? Are not his days also like the days of a hired man?
Like a servant who earnestly desires the shade, And like a hired man who eagerly looks for his wages,
So I have been allotted ((Job 15:31)) months of futility, And wearisome nights have been appointed to me.
(Deut. 28:67; Job 7:13, 14) When I lie down, I say, ‘When shall I arise, And the night be ended?’ For I have had my fill of tossing till dawn.
My flesh is (Is. 14:11) caked with worms and dust, My skin is cracked and breaks out afresh.
“My (Job 9:25; 16:22; 17:11; Is. 38:12; (James 4:14)) days are swifter than a weaver’s shuttle, And are spent without hope.
Oh, remember that (Job 7:16; Ps. 78:39; 89:47) my life is a breath! My eye will never again see good.
(Job 8:18; 20:9) The eye of him who sees me will see me no more; While your eyes are upon me, I shall no longer be.
As the cloud disappears and vanishes away, So (2 Sam. 12:23) he who goes down to the grave does not come up.
He shall never return to his house, (Ps. 103:16) Nor shall his place know him anymore.
“Therefore I will (Ps. 39:1, 9) not restrain my mouth; I will speak in the anguish of my spirit; I will (1 Sam. 1:10) complain in the bitterness of my soul.
Am I a sea, or a sea serpent, That You set a guard over me?
